page.title: 07ARRETON VILLAGE
page.content:
Arreton Village lies at the base of the south slope of Arreton Down, about 4 miles from Newport, consisting mainly of the old village near by the Church of St. George and a straggling line of houses and cottages on the main Newport _ Sandown road, known as Arreton Street. Several of these older buildings are very interesting to the lover of the old and picturesque, particularly Stile House lying to the west of the church. Stile House was built in the early 17th century, on the site of an earlier building and was formerly used for brewing the church ales.This building is now called the Red Lion.
The White Lion Inn lies to the south of the church in Arreton Street. It is probably 17th century, much altered, but was once a coaching inn.
